intro: Cheiridopsis bifida, commonly known as the two-lobed ice plant, is a succulent belonging to the Aizoaceae family. It is native to South Africa, particularly the Western Cape region, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant features a low-growing, mat-forming structure with fleshy, blue-green leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white powder. Its flowers are small, star-shaped, and typically appear in shades of yellow or orange, blooming in spring. Cheiridopsis bifida is well adapted to arid conditions, storing water in its thick leaves and stems to survive periods of drought.
